## Description {#details}

Context for (re-)mapping values (and metadata).

A shared context used for mapping and remapping of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadata">Metadata</a> instances using <em><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a></em>, <em><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a77724415203930efd07d7098cb1e437d">RemapFlags</a></em>, <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemaptyperemapper">ValueMapTypeRemapper</a></em>, <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuematerializer">ValueMaterializer</a></em>, and <em>IdentityMD</em>.

There are a number of top-level entry points:
<ul>
<li><em><a href="#ae5adbfde952beb3b67c171e6b6429764">mapValue()</a></em> (and <em><a href="#abe2b1256305179d082979053910d0f8d">mapConstant()</a></em>);</li>
<li><em><a href="#a34e95c851d620226f791fcbe877762cf">mapMetadata()</a></em> (and <em><a href="#a33edb8d7bd7bce78ba42492330cc233a">mapMDNode()</a></em>);</li>
<li><em><a href="#a52c3da2ac81996e272ec9eadbd224517">remapInstruction()</a></em>;</li>
<li><em><a href="#abc0a2be8d6101a9ed7f565409fbe4151">remapFunction()</a></em>; and</li>
<li><em><a href="#ae3e49b91eb8536c50030213a24dea440">remapGlobalObjectMetadata()</a></em>.</li>
</ul>


The <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuematerializer">ValueMaterializer</a></em> can be used as a callback, but cannot invoke any of these top-level functions recursively. Instead, callbacks should use one of the following to schedule work lazily in the <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemapper">ValueMapper</a></em> instance:
<ul>
<li><em><a href="#a7c73fec2158f89a9339a366f5827df4b">scheduleMapGlobalInitializer()</a></em></li>
<li><em><a href="#ad87dbabd93d50b016817bf54b0345340">scheduleMapAppendingVariable()</a></em></li>
<li><em><a href="#adc967f437f5d05f0921816addf1ed9c7">scheduleMapGlobalAlias()</a></em></li>
<li><em><a href="#a8e20a241c1637ffe908adac8a5011f43">scheduleMapGlobalIFunc()</a></em></li>
<li><em><a href="#a84b3f8c68eba85bccc6d26e69679b5fe">scheduleRemapFunction()</a></em></li>
</ul>


Sometimes a callback needs a different mapping context. Such a context can be registered using <em><a href="#a995e15c9fb470ea7ad0ad64a2107cb2d">registerAlternateMappingContext()</a></em>, which takes an alternate <em><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a></em> and <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuematerializer">ValueMaterializer</a></em> and returns a <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> to pass into the schedule&#42;() functions.

If an <em>IdentityMD</em> set is optionally provided, <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadata">Metadata</a></em> inside this set will be mapped onto itself in <em>VM</em> on first use.

TODO: lib/Linker really doesn&#39;t need the <em>ValueHandle</em> in the <em><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a></em>. We should template <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemapper">ValueMapper</a></em> (and its implementation classes), and explicitly instantiate on two concrete instances of <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemap">ValueMap</a></em> (one as <em><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#afab3631a764c3f3a60ca9b1c0d7d5967">ValueToValueMap</a></em>, and one with raw <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></em> pointers). It may be viable to do away with <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingmdref">TrackingMDRef</a></em> in the <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadata">Metadata</a></em> side map for the lib/Linker case as well, in which case we&#39;ll need a new template parameter on <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemap">ValueMap</a></em>.

TODO: Update callers of <em><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7da684e1cead3524bdd9b0d171aad161">RemapInstruction()</a></em> and <em><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7d7375d2149eafc730d09e8e48089021">MapValue()</a></em> (etc.) to use <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuemapper">ValueMapper</a></em> directly.

Definition at line 154 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/valuemapper-h">ValueMapper.h</a>.

### registerAlternateMappingContext() {#a995e15c9fb470ea7ad0ad64a2107cb2d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned ValueMapper::registerAlternateMappingContext (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a> &amp; VM, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuematerializer">ValueMaterializer</a> &#42; Materializer=nullptr)</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> an alternate mapping context.

Returns a MappingContextID that can be used with the various schedule&#42;() API to switch in a different value map on-the-fly.

### remapDbgRecord() {#a06197e7841d4afc1dac5d5e812818fbf}
